definition: to lift a ban
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
surname Xie
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to transport under guard
surname Feng
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters

sentences.english: Unban request we be done once a week from now.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要一個星期來處理解封要求。

sentences.english: I hope that when war is over, we will unblock these sites.
sentences.chinese: 我希望戰爭結束後，我們能解封這些網址。

sentences.english: Now that the account is open, you may log in and check on character restorations .
sentences.chinese: 現在該帳號已解封，您可以登陸並確認角色是否恢復。

sentences.english: We will not un-ban your account regardless of the reason.
sentences.chinese: 無論什麼原因，我們不會解封你的賬戶。

definition: to ban (narcotics, a movie etc)/to block (a road etc)/(Internet) to block (a user)
title granted to a person (archaic)/to ban an (online) account
to freeze (water etc)/(fig.) to freeze (assets, prices etc)
seal (on envelopes)
to reopen
ruling/adjudication
to unbind (e.g. a phone number from an account)
to file a complaint/to appeal (to an authority, a higher court of justice etc)/complaint/appeal
to screen/to block (sth or sb)/to shield/(protective) shield
to log in (to a computer)/to enter (data)
to clear/to empty
to remove/to sack/to get rid of/to relieve (sb of their duties)/to free/to lift (an embargo)/to rescind (an agreement)
scope of authority/extent of power/(access etc) privileges
to fail/to lose effectiveness
to alter
to state/to assert/to allege/to specify
